divs: Sighting DetailsSummary of Witness Statement from hbccufo website, Brian Vike, Director:Object was oval in shape. Coming from the east and horizontal. As it gets veryclose it turns to a vertical position and emits a red glow. Remains sidewaysfor a few seconds, then simply blinks off. Just disappeared. The moon wasrising to the southeast of vantage point, air was surreal and it was quiet. Witness Statements from Nov. 13 & 15 e-mails:I can offer you no further information regarding November 8, 2003, except whatBrian Vike posted.The Light came in in a horizontal position. It was turning to its side orvertical as I was proceeding to take the picture. It emitted a reddish glow orreflection around it but was clearly BRILLIANT white itself. It stoppedand before I snapped again it just VANISHED.I may only add that when it was coming in horizontal from the east it wasmore of a blue color....I later watched the eclipse and have had no furtherincidents.It is our estimation that the object or light was 30 long in the verticalposition.
Summary: Bright oval object approached, turned on side, van
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Glenwood
There were no other sightings in Glenwood on or around November 8th 2003
